perturbation.original_text: 1. DEFINITIONS. (a) "CONTENT" means all content or information, in any medium, provided by a party to the other party for use in conjunction with the performance of its obligations hereunder, including without limitation any text, music, sound, photographs, video, graphics, data or software. Content provided by 2TheMart is referred to herein as "2TheMart Content" and Content provided by i-Escrow is referred to herein as "i-Escrow Content."
perturbation.changed_text: 1. DEFINITIONS. (a) "CONTENT" means all digital assets, regardless of medium, that either party provides to the other for use in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement. This includes, but is not limited to, text, audio files, visual recordings, images, datasets, or programs. Assets given by 2TheMart will be known as "2TheMart Material," while assets given by i-Escrow are termed "i-Escrow Media."
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'CONTENT', '2TheMart Content,' and 'i-Escrow Content' are replaced with 'digital assets,' '2TheMart Material,' and 'i-Escrow Media,' respectively. This creates confusion as to whether the original definitions still apply, potentially altering the scope of content covered under the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 5. PAYMENT. 5.1 ADVERTISING FEES. After the Launch Date, i-Escrow shall pay 2TheMart advertising fees based on the number of Transaction Inquiries. This advertising fees shall consist of a per Transaction Inquiry amount calculated by multiplying 0.025% by the amount of the average Transaction from all Customers in the preceding quarter. The formula for arriving at the per Transaction Inquiry amount may be revised from time to time during the term of this Agreement to reflect present market conditions ("the Adjusted Rate"), but only by mutual consent of the parties after good faith discussions. The Adjusted Rate shall be added as an addendum to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. PAYMENT. 5.1 ADVERTISING FEES. After the Launch Date, i-Escrow shall pay 2TheMart advertising fees based on the volume of Customer Engagements. This advertising remuneration will equal a rate per Customer Engagement that is determined by multiplying 0.025% by the median revenue per Customer from the prior fiscal period. This rate may be updated periodically during the duration of the contract following market analysis and with written consent from both parties ("the Revised Pricing"). The Revised Pricing will be attached as an exhibit to this contract.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Transaction Inquiries', 'average Transaction from all Customers', 'preceding quarter' and 'Adjusted Rate' are replaced with 'Customer Engagements', 'median revenue per Customer', 'prior fiscal period' and 'Revised Pricing,' respectively. This introduces ambiguity on how advertising fees are calculated, potentially affecting the payment obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 9. INDEMNITY. Each party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify the other party (the "Indemnified Party") against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which the Indemnified Party may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from the Indemnifying Party's acts, omissions or misrepresentations to the extent that the Indemnified Party is deemed a principal of the Indemnifying Party. In addition, 2TheMart shall indemnify i-Escrow against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which i-Escrow may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from 2TheMart Content. In addition, i-Escrow shall indemnify 2TheMart against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which 2TheMart may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from i-Escrow Source: 2THEMART COM INC, 10-12G, 8/26/1999 Content and or the Services provided to Customers.
perturbation.changed_text: 9. INDEMNITY. Each party (the "Guarantor") shall protect the other party (the "Protected Party") from any and all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, specifically including legal counsel payments, that the Protected Party accrues due to external grievances resulting from the Guarantor's actions, failures, or deceptive statements, provided the Protected Party is considered a key agent of the Guarantor. Furthermore, 2TheMart will protect i-Escrow from all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, inclusive of justifiable legal costs, that i-Escrow bears due to external grievances derived from 2TheMart Material. Additionally, i-Escrow will protect 2TheMart from all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, including justified attorney costs, that 2TheMart bears due to external grievances arising from i-Escrow Source: 2THEMART COM INC, 10-12G, 8/26/1999 Media and/or the Deliverables provided to Patrons.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Indemnifying Party', 'Indemnified Party', 'claims, losses, costs and expenses', 'attorneys' fees', '2TheMart Content', 'i-Escrow Content', 'Services', and 'Customers' are replaced with 'Guarantor', 'Protected Party', 'liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures', 'legal counsel payments', '2TheMart Material', 'i-Escrow Media', 'Deliverables' and 'Patrons'. This substitution introduces potential disagreements about the scope of indemnity, what costs are covered, and who the beneficiaries are, leading to possible disputes.
